ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this class to fellow students. The way the course was structured was extremely helpful in terms of thinking about how to break down the work of research projects. The subject matter -- saints -- was also very interesting.
I would recommend this course to another student specializing in medieval history, though not for a non-medievalist.

This class is primarily an exploration of different approaches to historical research concerning the middle ages, couched (in this case) in questions about Medieval Saints. One learns both about the general issues surrounding medieval historical inquiry, and about the specific history of Sainthood.I would highlyrecommend the course. Obviously, I certain knowledge of Latin is required, so I would recommend the course to those who had the basic skill set!

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Allowed me to think more consciously about methodology, research tools than most courses in my field.

I found this course extremely useful because it formalized general impressions about the research process that I had formulated on my own. While I am still in the early stages of thinking about my dissertation, I am sure that this course will continue to be useful throughout my time here.
